Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery jar, blackened by smoke, the fabric is light-brown and grey in section, with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior including a reference to a head beekeeper.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393549) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393549)
